Entry.1:
Started work on a culvert at Ramousies.

Nearly had a strike but it blew over alright. They worked instead.
Entry.2: Everything going well am dining with the 10th A.A.S.C.
Entry.3: Still going strong like Johnny Walker Whiskey
Entry.4: Started putting in the sets today. Also a little filling in. Saw a game of Rugby. Very poor.
Entry.5: No work today cos we ran out of nails. Major rang up for "rugby players but the boys refused to go in.
Entry.6: Went into Sains to the dentist borrowed a horse for the job. Had to go to Lussies to look at a bridge. Was quite OK.
Entry.7: Work as usual. On the filling now. Gee it is going to take some filling
Entry.8: Again into Sains to the dentist. No work today 'cos the Waggons didn't turn up.
Entry.9: Relieved by Scrivener of the job. Return to the battn tomorrow
Entry.10: Went to Sains again & actually got fixed finally. Shoofed it back to Beaurieux. Back at the old billet.
Entry.11: Took up the Sports Officer again & did a few necessary odd jobs. Kerr is O.C. the Coy now.
Entry.12:
Left Beaurieux 

Got 2 pm train to Brussels & arrived there at 5.30 pm. Got a hotel & 

then had dinner. Went to a picture show & night dancing places.
Entry.13: Left Brussels at 5.20 am & arrived Paris 9 pm. Went thro Tournai, , La Bassee, Loos, Dernancourt, Heilly, Corbie, Amiens all along the old battlefront & gee it is some knocked about. Taxi couldn't find the place we wanted for a long time but finally got settled.
Entry.14: Visited Champs Ellyses Place de la Concorde & Arc de Truimphe
Entry.15: Visited Notre Dame, Hotel de Ville, Napoleans tomb & Invalides. Went to see Casino de Paris & saw Mistinguett & Chevalier. They were very good
Entry.16: Saw Folies Bergene Walked along grand Boulevards & then to the Madeleine
Entry.17: Did round trip of Paris with the Y.M. Was very good Went to see Nouveau Cirque in the evening. Was goodo
Entry.18: Did Versailles with the YM & gee it was great. also went to the opera with them & saw A Ida. Was exceptionally good specially the orchestra.
Entry.19: Went to see the Australians play rugby against the french. Very poor game. Diggers won by 1 try to nil.
Entry.20: Up at 2 pm. Went to Bank. YM Kodaks for films & negs. Had a busy afternoon. Went out for dinner.
Entry.21: Up at 4 am & after a lot of bustle we managed to get a seat in second class compt. Still it was a seat. Train was very slow. At 1.15 crowd rushed for dinner waggon & train started leaving about 20 or 30 on a platform. At 7 it waited 2 ½ so could easy have stopped for them Got to Brussels at 1 am.
Entry.22: Visited all the main sights in Brussels Edith Cavell statue, Palais de Justice, Palais Royale etc. All very nice buildings Prices in the shops very expensive. Had nice afternoon tea. Went to a picture show & then home to bed.
Entry.23: Left Brussells for Charleroi. As usual train was packed & we only managed to get a 3rd class seat. Got the leave bus back to Sobie but got off when opposite Beaurieux. arriving there about 3 pm. Still the same old billet but the officers in the coy changed some. Mac away in hospital still. Bill in charge. Pelly Peck back with Cowlishaw (recafts officer) besides Scriv & Bill Hammond.
Entry.24: Started off by nosing round for sports teams very slow tho. Too many away & being demobilised. Can't keep a team at all.
Entry.25: Put on as duty officer as well as Sports Officer. Kicked up a row of course. On board of enquiry into loss of two horses. They were pinched.
Entry.26: Nothing to do all day 'cept sit on a court of enquiry over two horses pinched last night.
Entry.27: Much the same as yesterday. As usual we were very late for brekker.
Entry.28: Taken off ord. officer but got another job for the day. Had to do some reconaissance work & only just got back when a message came for me that I was to go to Havre on the Demobilisation staff.
Entry.29: Met Johnny Walker at 9.30 & left Sobie at 11 am for Charleroi arriving there at 1. Went to the Club for lunch & then out to Chatelet to see Dad Hunter Had to wait about 3 hours for him. Had dinner with him & then slept the night at his billet. He looks as well as ever. Light fall of snow.
Entry.30: Came in from Chatelet & had brekker at the club. Then going to the train. It consisted of converted trucks. Some have five places & some haven't so of course got in one with the crowd of fellows were good. Had about 12 in our truck. About 1800 on the train. Had tea at Mong. Very cold out.
Entry.31: Still on the train. Had tons of stops. The boys ratted a couple of supply trains & got wine etc. Quite a lot finished up being drunck. The driver took his engine off at Arras because he couldn't get a relief We waited there 10 hours till the frogs put an engine on. Got plenty of strain
Entry.32: Arrived at Harfleur Halle at 2 pm. We were some tired too. Altho we slept warm & had a good sleep. Marched to the camp & went to the A.G.B.D. No body has any idea of what is going to happen to us yet. Our home is in a hut without a stove & on the floor.
Entry.33: Checked for orderly officer straight away. As usual very little to do. Managed to do the needful. Got a job at 9 pm tho & had to go to the station & wait till a train came in & then guide the diggers to the camp. Got home at1 am. Still on the floor. Sleep in my valise tonight. Too cold otherwise.
Entry.34: Nothing to do at all today. Very cold all night. Still on the floor. Moved to a new hut. Tons of mud everywhere. Into Havre today. List went up showing our positions etc on the staff. In an HQ & allotted.
Entry.35: Still cold. Moved again to another hut. this time to a bed & the hut partitioned. Much better. Into Havre again.
Entry.36: Snowed last night & part of the morning. Very heavy too.
Entry.37: Very cold again. Everything frozen. Got a job of walking to Harfleur see all diggers saluted & were properly dressed etc None saluted as usual but sad to say I didn't correct them. Went straight into Havre.
Entry.38: Very cold again today. Our home tho' isn't too bad but would be much improved with a stove.
Entry.39: Cold again. Met Haldane He looks well He is in this
Entry.40: Some cold today again. Into Havre again. Nothing else to do.
Entry.41: Cold again. Did practically nothing all day. Am on the Committee for the forming of the next mess.
Entry.42: Cold again but still see the men so it isn't too bad. Saw a basketball match between the Yank Officers & Con. Camp Officers. Yanks won easily (37 points to 10) Had a dance after & met some Yank Y.M. girls. They were good fun.
Entry.43: Nice & warm. Went to a dance in the Con Camp & had a bonny time. Do me.
Entry.44: Leave came thro for Blighty. Have to move some to get on to the boat but once on had to wait about 6 hrs. When we started tho it was O.K. Had dinner on board.
Entry.45:
Awakened at 5.30 & we had stopped. Had a look & found we had stopped on account of fog. Made us very late. Didn't land till 1 pm. Had to collect the diggers & then got away. Wired Marie. Got train to London 

Went out to dinner with them and then to Brixton Theatre & saw Babes in the Wood. Was fair. Went to supper after & got home at 2.30 am.
Entry.46: Busy all the morning running to Horseferry Road. Met Dad Hunter & he, Harry & I went out to lunch, then Dad & I went out to Marie's & had tea. Dad left early to go to his aunts & Marie & I went to see the Lilac Domino. It was good. Touched Grand opera in places, singing tho was poor. Went back to the flat for Supper.
Entry.47: Up at 11 am. As usual had brekker in bed. Went to Maries. Took Dad. Janet turned up later on. Dad had to leave again so we three went for a walk & then came home to supper. Saw Janet on to her bus. It rained all day.
Entry.48: As usual its raining Went & saw Harry Brenett. Met Dad & we three went to lunch to a nice quiet little french cafe. Then went out to Marie & we went to see Madam Tressaud's Wax Works. It was very good. Janet came out & we then met Dad & went to dinner & then to 'Yes Uncle' Was goodo. Back for supper to Maries. Janet staying with Marie.
Entry.49: Snow this morning & also rain. Ran round as Dad went to his Auntie at Colchester. Harry & I went to lunch & also to dinner at the french cafe. After dinner went for a stroll & then to Lyon's Corner House in the Strand for coffee. Music here was excellent.
Entry.50: Rushed around in the morning. Met Marie after lunch & we went to Westminster Abbey & Cathedral. Gee it is great. Beats the frog churches easily. Went out to Janet's hospital for dinner & had a gay old time. Janet & I broke a glass as I was drinking. It cut her finger & my lip. Not very serious tho. as usual it rained all day.
Entry.51: Rained again. Great hobby of London this rain. Went out to Brixton in the afternoon. then rushed out to Dad's place & had dinner & then he took his Aunt, her Cousin & Kris to see Chu Chin Chow. Enjoyed it immensely. Was excellent & could go again.
Entry.52: Went to Horseferry Rd with Dad then to see about my application for Non Military Employment. It is over alright but they haven't a position for me yet. Will go to see a man about it tomorrow. Marie took me out to the Arsenal. Gee she knows a lot of people there. Had a look over the Small arms post. It is very good. Had dinner at an Italian cafe & then we went to see Box & Tricks. Wasn't very keen on it tho'.
Entry.53: Went out to see about my N.M.E. but the man wasn't in so left a note for him & made an appointment for Thursday. Took Marie to see a soccer match Milwall V Chelsea. Game was poor. Chelsea won 3 to 2. Went to the Coventry for dinner & then to The Officers Mess at the Prince's Theatre.
Entry.54: Went to Marie's at 1.30 pm & then we went to a concert at Albert Hall. Gee it was good. The hall is glorious & so was the orchestra & the girl who sang. We got back home at 5 & found 3 visitors. Went in & got tea ready & Janet turned up, so also did two more visitors. Had tea & then the visitors left & we three had dinner & then we rushed off to get my train for Edinburgh. Got a good bunk too.
Entry.55: Arrived Edinburgh at 8 am. Went to the Royal & got a room. Then had brekker & went out to Comely Bank but Annie was ill in bed with kidney trouble. Had a good talk with her & then came back here for lunch & went out to Corstorphine. Both Auntie & Uncle are well. They both took me to Adolf's he was working on a motor carbo. We didn't stay long. Went back to Comely Bank & met uncle & after tea he took me to York Place where I met some artist pals of Marie's. Stayed there till 10 pm & then came back to the hotel to bed
Entry.56: Met Uncle Bill at 10.15 am & went with him to his tailors & got measured for a grey suit. Have to try on tomorrow. Then did some shopping & then to the Council Chambers & heard a council meeting. Had lunch there & had a look at the museum. It was great. After this I had a look at St. Giles Church & gee it is great as good as any I've seen. Then went out to Comely Bank again. Auntie was much better & was up. Had tea & then uncle & I went to some movies & then back home for supper. Got a big parcel of greens to take back to London for Marie.
Entry.57: Went to Lambert's & tried the suit on. It looks very well indeed. Then over to the Caledonian Station & got the train to Glasgow. Wandered around till 1.45 pm (an hour) had lunch & then met Harry. She had to go back to the kids so I went out to see Alice Vernon. She is a very homely sort of person & persists in making one keep eating. The two boys came home & I showed them how to play marbles etc & gave them a general rough vocabulary. Gave Arthur one of my wristlet watches & 2/- to Ernie. Harry then came along & she & Alice took me to along to meet Ernest. He was a door Keeper at Clara Butt's concert. Then took Harry & Alice to dinner at the Grosvenor & then caught the train to London
Entry.58:
1919\

Janet's Birthday

Got to Euston at 6.15 am & then straight to Jermyn Court Hotel. Had to wait for brekker & a shave. Went out & saw about getting a job but missed everywhere. Was busy all day. Went to Marie's flat at 5.30 pm & took the big parcel of greens & the choc for Janet. Janet arrived late so we had to rush for dinner. Had a dinner at the Trocadero & then went to see Hello America. It was very good. Very bright & lively. Then back to the flat for supper. It was good too but none of us were hungry as we had eaten too many chocs.
Entry.59: Saw about playing football but crashed again. Don't seem to have much luck at present. Will see how we start tomorrow. Marie & I went to the Zoo this afternoon & enjoyed it. Had dinner at some Soho restaurant and then out to the Old Vic theatre to see a Shakespeare play. A Winter's Tale. Gee I enjoyed it. It was great. The acting being excellent. Sent a parcel of views & my two diaries home to mother.
Entry.60:
Went to Eaton Place to see about work but couldn't get any. Have made an appointment with the Studebaker people for Monday. Took Marie & Janet to see the King review The Young Guards & then to the football match at Fulham. Fulham played Chelsea & won easily 6 to 2. There was a tremendous crowd at both shows.

McGowan came out to dinner. His right wing is still sore & won't be right for some time. Took Janet to see the Naughty Wife. Gladys Cooper is the lead. It was excellent. Gladys Cooper had a broken arm & still played. Enjoyed it immensely.
Entry.61: Up at 1.30 for lunch. Bonny day too. Wrote a couple of letters & then met Janet & we wandered round St James, Hyde & Regent Parks. Had tea at Marie's. She was out & had dinner at Pagani's in Gt. Portland Street & then back to Marie's. She was home then. Janet has a job as a V.A,D for Marie.
Entry.62: Busy all day. Rushed about looking for work but crashed. finished up by getting a letter from Harry. Took Marie to dinner at the Gobelen. Janet couldn't come cos the Princess was inspecting their Hospital. Took Janet & Marie to see Babes in the Wood at Drury Lane. It was excellent. Both acting & staging.
Entry.63: Got train to Southampton at 11.35 & arrived Southampton 2 pm. Had lunch & found the boat. It was a Yank named Yale & wasn't going till 10 pm. We went into town & had tea. Booked seats for a show & wandered about. Went to the sho & met two Naval people also 2 girls. Took the girls home & then back to the boat. It wasn't leaving till 5.30 am & as we hadn't had any dinner we blew back to a fish & chips joint & had a feed. Getting on to the boat at 1 am.
Entry.64: There was a race between 2 Yank boats. Brekker was cruel. 1 cup coffee, Scrambled egg, some potatoes & a bit of bacon. Cost us 4/-. Our boat lost the race. Got up at 2.30. Had afternoon tea at the club & then back here to camp. Met Bill Cowper. Got about 20 letters. Had dinner & went to a concert.
Entry.65: Raining today but cleared up about 11 am. The sun then coming out. Bill & I went out. Had lunch at the club & then went on to the Nirvana & had tea with a couple of boys I met. Then went out to Bill's cousins & had dinner. After dinner had a bit of a sing & rushed down for our train but missed & had to get a taxi for the camp
Entry.66: Wrote 15 letters today. Have a job tonight. Not very strenuous tho. Job consisted of a picquet at the top end of Rue de Paris. Everything was quiet & we came home at 9.30 pm. Caught two Waacs. Rained all day.
Entry.67: Bill & I went into Havre. I was on duty but it consisted of going to the club & writing letters. Met the Waacs & went to St Addresse with them. Lovely afternoon after the heavy rain in the morning.
Entry.68: No parades still on account of the rain. Wrote 4 letters. Went out to Bill's cousins & had a great old time. Kept them full of laughter. We told their fortunes by cards etc. Sang quite a lot. Had a very pleasant day. Just managed to get our train.
Entry.69: Wrote letters all day & went in late to bring out a team. Everything was goodo. Very quiet. Had parade today.
Entry.70: Didn't go into town till evening. Then went in to take charge of the teams. Had a good feed at the club. The boys were rowdy. Broke one window. Took up a collection & fixed it up OK.
Entry.71: Very beaut day. Bill & I went out to his cousins. Went for a good stroll. All over the cliffs at St Addresse first. Taught his cousin how to play bridge. Got our train easily. His was on Special patrol. A real decent job
Entry.72: Rain all the afternoon but was very nice in the morning. Went to Mountivilliers for a stroll. Did quite a lot of renovating in the hut. Played basketball at the gym. Gee I'm soft. Very. Had a talk with , Gray, Laggugreen & Freckleton. They are all down waiting to go home.
Entry.73: On boat picquet today. Left here at 3 pm & got back at 8 pm. No trouble at all. Saw some of the old off. Very cold tonight.
Entry.74: On special duty at the Rouelles station today . Went down to see if the Nirvana was in but it wasn't so we blew out to Bill's cousins place. Had dinner & taught them some more bridge. Got wet through coming home. Didn't have our coats & of course it rained a soon as we got out of the train.
Entry.75: Went to Bills cousins & had the usual old sing song. Only saw a little of the sun.
Entry.76: Very dull all day today. Hotel De Ville picquet tonight. Went for a stroll & did the usual work. Things very quiet tonight. Bus called early so we were home in camp at 10 pm.
Entry.77: Special patrol today. Bill, George & I went to Avelings & stayed there till midnight dancing & singing. Walked home via Rouelles & Les Acacias. Got home at 1.45. Good going. Do me. Have a bonny cold.
Entry.78: Rained all day & night. Went to dancing class at the gym & learnt the foxtrot & Missouri waltz. Went to Mountvilliers. Went to dentist again. Becoming quite a permanent thing now.
Entry.79: Nice & sunny all day. Have train picquet tonight. Wrote 5 letters. Bill Cowper left for Huppiy. Can't speak at all today. lost my voice.
Entry.80: Was orderly officer all day. Did very little indeed. Got out of everything. Voice still gone.
Entry.81: Have some cold can't speak. Went to Bills cousins place. Took George. Played cards all the time. Managed to get our train home OK.
Entry.82: Cold on the improve. Had brekker in bed. Have a poisoned leg now. It is some sore too. Went in & did Rue de Paris picquet tho. It was icy cold & rained some.
Entry.83: In bed all day with my leg. Read a couple of books. Very cold. Rained all day & night & also snowed to some order.
Entry.84: Got up today. Too cold in bed. Leg improving. Got 5 letters & answered them. Went for a stroll (about 150). Very cold today. Voice is still gone. Am going back to my unit in a day or so. Was told today Three new officers have come down here for duty so it relieves us. Do me.
Entry.85: Went to Mountivilliers. Wrote letters & played Gutzers & Rummy. Had an offer today of going to Blighty tomorrow & Aussie on the p.t. Turned it down Cos I want 6 months in Blighty first. Can get Aussie then. Quite easily.
Entry.86: Back to camp at noon. Leg dressed & lunch. Got put on duty for tomorrow. Am sick of staying here in Camp. Got a couple of letters & wrote 3. Rained all the morning but quite sunny after lunch.
Entry.87: Rained all the morning but fine in the afternoon. Had a kick in the afternoon & hurt my leg a little. Was on train picquet. Things very quiet tho. Had a sing afterwards. Was goodo.
Entry.88: Very decent day. Went into town & had lunch with the boys from the Nirvana. Went back to camp for tea & then went in again & did train picquet for Hopkins cos I want tomorrow off.
Entry.89: Had a look at a game of football & then went out to St Addresse . Had a sing & a dance & then came home. After getting into bed who should turn up but Bill Cowper. He's back for good. Do me.
Entry.90:
Lovely day. Played football in the afternoon & did quite OK. Will be alright again when I get a bit of fat off. Base played 20 quota & won by 3 or 4 goals

Bill & I went to Montivilliers after dinner. Saw Suzanna & had a talk with her.
Entry.91: Real bonny day again. Do me. Am very tired. Took the picquet in. Did the necessary but didn't go back with them. Parry took them home. Everything was OK tho. Hopkins came along early in the evening & we took a sergeant to the club for dinner. The sergeant wore my warm. Some stunt.
Entry.92: Lovely day once more. Was dusty in town tho. didn't hit camp till 11 pm. Bill & I went out to St.Addresse & sang a bit. Had a very quiet night altogether.
Entry.93: Lovely day again. Met Moffitt, Carmichael, Bruce Oliver & Bruce Sloan. Went & had a look at a game of soccer which was cruel. Was in charge of trains again. Things were very quiet tho. Had to meet a V.A.D. but she didn't turn up but her pal did & explained matters.
Entry.94: Lovely day again. We seem to be getting our issue. Met Harry Thomas this morning. Steve Flew couldn't go to Rouen so after a lot of persuasion I went in his place. Was on duty in the afternoon but filled the report in. Also one for tomorrow night. Some scream this show. Left Havre at 5.10 pm in the Paris express & reached Rouen at 6.50 pm. Went to the club but they didn't keep beds so went around to the Hotel D'Angliterre & got set. Was still quite light so we wandered around & just picked up our bearings
Entry.95: Up at 8 am & round to the club for brekker. Visited the cathedral & climbed the tower. Took a few snaps. The town was very misty. The cathedral is beautiful both inside & outside. Real old gothic. visited Hotel du Ville, Church at St Ouen, Palais de Justice. Gros Horloge. My description of these things will have to be put on the photos I've taken if they turn out OK. After lunch at the club we went out to Bousicoin & saw Joan d'Arc's monument. Got an excellent view of the town from here, also a good view of the Seine. It is very picturesque. Visited the Hotel Bourgtheoillde. Only saw the outside which has plenty of carvings. Visited the place where Joan d'Arc was burned. Also the Tower Joan d'Arc the place where she was imprisoned. This town is all that is left of a huge Chateau (called Chateau de Rouen). Met French at the club & and had dinner with him. Ordered a drink & 2 oranges at the hotel. Got them but found the oranges cost 2 F each. Sent them back.
Entry.96: Brekker at Club. Visited St Macloun church. There was a service on still we had a look. Very pretty indeed. The choir being exquisite the building itself is very nice also. Then saw church St Patrice which has excellent stained glass windows. Very good We then went to the Picture Gallery but it was closed with the exception of an exposition which we saw. It was very poor indeed. Then to church St Godard. This was closed so we only saw the outside. Back for lunch. After lunch saw Church St Vivien which also has beautiful windows. There was a service for children on in this. Met French again had dinner & then to see a show at the Follies Bergere. It was terrible. We left at 11.30 half way thro the show. Walked a bit & then home to the hotel to bed.
Entry.97:
Brekker at the club & then to the station for the train. Saw the Maison Morrow with its beautiful carved wood. Gee its good. Also saw (from the street) Church St Romain. Left Rouen at 10.22 am & arrive here in Havre at noon. Got a lift in 2 motor lorries right to the camp. A big bundle of letters awaited me. Had lunch & then played basket ball.

Was on Hotel de Ville picquet. Took them in but missed the bus coming home 'cos I was away with one of the boys. A train wouldn't stop for me so ran after it & pulled the pole off the car. I could get on quite easily. Caused quite a sensation in the train for a while.
Entry.98: Missed parade again this morning. Am on special patrol today & no job tomorrow. Met Garry & took him round to see different places. Bill came in & we had dinner at a little french cafe. Had lobster. Goodo.
Entry.99: Bill & I visited St Addresse . Got the train home OK. Got my negs & prints. Quite good.
Entry.100: Orderly officer today. Did very little. Rained all day. Bill got word of going to Blighty for non military employment.
Entry.101: Pass came thro & Bill managed to get a duty pass for Paris. Rushed around a bit & we managed to catch the 5 pm train. Got to Paris & we went to the Aussie Y.M. & got a room (Hotel ). Took Bill & Sgt. Kerr to the Boulevard for a walk & showed them a few things.
Entry.102: Went to Versailles & gee it was good. Quite a lot of tapestry is now on view. Also went thro. part of the park. Gee it is beautiful. Had dinner with the Y, M people & then to the opera. Saw Hamlet & it was excellent. Did me. Apres the show went for a stroll & then back for supper & bed.
Entry.103: Rained all day but cleared for an hour or two in the afternoon. Went thro. a market where they sold everything. Snails, frogs & all that sort of thing. Then went to Sacre Couer & enjoyed it immensely. Had lunch at a small cafe (for a huge price). Afterwards went on a YM Trip on the river. First to the Marne & then to St Cloud. Gee it is some trip. Enjoyed it immensely. The view from St Cloud is beautiful. Got out at St Cloud & had our photos taken & also some tea. Went to the Follies Bergere & the show was good. Plenty of legs of course. Went for a stroll after & then home to bed.
Entry.104: Rained all day. Went to Naps tomb but it was closed. Then to Panthion de la Geurre. Gee it is some picture. It represents the war from the frogs point of view. Had lunch at Poccardio & then as it was raining we went to a picture show for an hour. Went into Au Printemps huge shop & bought some face cream. Had tea at the Hotel & then got the train & arrived at Havre at 9.30 pm. Gee it was cold & windy. Got the train home & had supper & then to bed.
Entry.105: Rained all the morning. Saw the boys & took Suly Vidal & Bill Hammond into town. Went out to St Addresse & Bill & I went down to catch his boat but he slipped amp; doesn't go till tomorrow.
Entry.106: Bonny day today. Actually went on parade. Said good bye to the boys. Bill left for Blighty. Got word of my N.M. to being thro. Was on Hotel de Ville picquet. Saw the Avelings taking Mrs to the boat. Went to the dance after & had about 8. Enjoyed 'em too. An Aussie mail came yesterday.
Entry.107: Little sun today. Very little too. Went into town & visited the museum & a couple of churches. They were all worth seeing specially one of the churches which had glorious windows. Was on the No 2 train. Jock Kennedy offered me a job to play football in Melbourne. Did not accept tho. Will see later.
Entry.108: No sun at all today. Am on Harfleur picquet but am not going there as I have a meet on in town. Very trying day. Wrote a few letters & went into town. Met the girl & went for a walk to St Addresse
Entry.109: Very muggy again. A very trying day. Went to Montivilliers for a walk. Hotel de Ville again tonight. A few fights by the Canadians in the street. Otherwise everything very quiet.
Entry.110:
Dusty all day. Went out to St Addresse with George & stayed there till train time. Did all sorts of things with the boy. Played cricket etc. sang, played cards & ate. (The easiest of the lot). Was supposed to be on Special patrol. Did it out there.

Monday 21 April 1919

Train strike today so didn't go into town. Went & dug Dad Hunter & after lunch we went & had a look at a game of football 'tween 4th & 5th Div.
Entry.111:
won by 4 points. Went to a fancy dress & masked ball at the Gym. Went as Bo peep. Some scream too. The show was excellent. Some lovely costumes there. Enjoyed it immensely. Supper too was good. Finished at 2.30 am, but I hopped off at 12.

No work for me at all today.
Entry.112: Beautiful day today. WAs on stand by but Lawo is doing it cos he is not too well. Am off work. Do me. Met Bill Axtell. He is going today. No trains again. Strike still on. Caught 8.30 pm train home.
Entry.113: Bonny day. Went into town & wandered around. Still no train. Caught the 8.30 train home. Got word of going to Blighty on N.M.E. tomorrow. Do me.
Entry.114: Gee my valise is some size. Still everything is in. Got a lorry for the valise. Going down to the quay had a fight with a frog cos he wouldn't let us go over a bridge before him. Tried to bluff him first but it wasn't any good so hit him. He kicked me then as I did the same. About 20 others closed in behind me but Parry hopped out too. Got the second mates cabin for 10/-. Went to be at 6.30 pm.
Entry.115:
ANZAC DAY

Off the boat at 9. Sent all the wires & wandered around till 11.30 when I met my girl. Went to big Road had dinner & then wandered thro' the forest. Caught the 4.54 pm train to town. Had dinner at the station & then came to Jermyn Court. Got a bonny room. Rang Janet up. She said Marie was home so rang Marie up & then went out there & met Bill. Janet followed so we had a good old meeting. Put them on a bus & a train & then got the tube home. Have to report in the morning.

The diggers marched thro town this morning & put up a bonny show.
Entry.116: Raining this morning. Bill & I wandered everywhere looking for flats or rooms. Went to see The Very Idea. Gee it's rough. Still we enjoyed it. Moved to Bill's hotel for a day or so. Its in Blomsbury Street.
Entry.117: Nice & sunny for an hour & then rain. Snowed later on & lasted all day. Very heavy too. Went to Twickenden to see Mrs. Aveling but she was out. Then went to Marie's flat & stayed there until 7 pm when we left to meet some girls. Took them to the Stoll Movie house & then home. Missed the last train & had to walk from Kings Cross to this place (in Blomsbury St).
Entry.118: Went everywhere looking for rooms or a flat. Did Earls Court, Edgeware Road, Southamptom Road & all over the city. Had lunch with Harry. Met all the theatrical heads. Harry Weldon & a host of others. Got fancy costume from Rayaio. Mine a cowboy & Bills a Dutch boy. Looked well. Went to the dance & thoroughly enjoyed it. Gee I had a bonny time. Mostly with Janet tho. The floor was good (had been an old ward) & the supper magnificent. Do me. Started at 8.30 pm & finished at 3.30 am. The sisters made beds for us on the floor in the dance ward so we were set. Went to bed about 4.30 am.
Entry.119: Up at 7 am. Got brekker at the hospital & then Bill & I kicked off. Bill to his class & me to take the gear back. Had a shave, another brekker & then got all our gear to the flat at Earls Court. Decided we'd go there. Met Bill for dinner & then came here to the flat after seeing Marie & Janet.
Entry.120: Up at 8.30. Gee Bill took some waking. Brekker very nice. Met Bill again after lunch. Went to Bank. Drew £40 for paying for the flat for 1 month. Went to the Popular for tea. Clicked. Took up to dinner at Molanaris. Had a little Champagne as Molanari shouted. Harry & Trix came in. Went for a walk & came home early.
Entry.121: Went to see about transfer of work but papers not back yet. Have to go again tomorrow. Reported sick & got some medicine for my stomach. Went to Hyde Park & listened to a band concert in the evening.
Entry.122: Wrote letters & then Bill & I went out to the hospital & helped the staff to entertain the Red Cross people. Had rather a good time. Had quite a lot of dances too. Got home at 1 am.
Entry.123: Tried to fix up about the school but found that I'd left some papers home. Will find it on Monday. Saw the march thro by the Dominion troops. Was very good. Went to Hyde Park after. Got home at 2 after wandering all over the place & waiting for tubes. Had decent day all day.
Entry.124: Met Marie, Janet & Violet with Miss Bick at Charing & we all went to Richmond by Steamer. Played cards & had a picnic. Boiled our own kettle & had a bonny time. Had to wait in a queue for a bus but eventually got home at 10 pm when we had tea. Bill & I missed our train so had to walk from Marie's flat to Earls Court. In bed by 2 am. Some walk.
Entry.125:
Fixed up to start at the Motor School. Took Bill to the 
hosp
 doctor & he sent him to WandsworthHospital with tonsillitis & influenza. Went out to Brixton to see Bill. Took him to the movies.
Entry.126: Went out & arranged to start class tomorrow. Got Motor drivers license. Took Janet, Marie & Violet out to Wandsworth to see Bill. He looks very seedy. Went back to the hospital with them & had tea there. Matron called us in at 10 pm & we had a talk & then she took us down & showed us how to make coffee It was goodo too. Drew £ 20.
Entry.127: Started the school today & got on very well. Had my first driving lesson & did OK. Went out & saw Bill & met his girl for him at 7.30. Came home & wrote letters.
Entry.128: Bonny day again. Saw Bill. He looks much better. Had another driving lesson. Went out to Brixton for tea & came home at 11 pm.
Entry.129: Lovely day again. Real decent weather at last. Went to the school. Had another driving lesson. Am doing well. After the lesson saw Bill. He looks a bit better. Then out to see Janet & Marie at their Jumble sale. Had tea there. Just as I left it rained very heavily.
Entry.130:
Met Dad & we wandered around. Got my glasses. Had lunch at 
Molarin
 Molinari's. Took Janet & Marie to see Bill. He had had a relapse & wasn't looking a bit well. Had tea at the flat & then took them to see Joy Bells. It is goodo too. Brought Dad Hunter home to supper. Got a taxi to go home & it got a puncture. Waited for him to fix it. Left Dad at Edgeware Rd & walked the rest. Got home at 2 am. Saw Miss Gillard at Marie's place.
Entry.131: Lovely day again. Took blankets out to Marie. Janet had not gone back to the hospital so saw her. Left the flat & got Bill's clothing (washing) & then came straight back to the flat. Pritchard came & brought a pal. Gave his pal a reference. Then had afty tea & wrote a couple of letters & then rushed out to the hospital to Janet. Helped Matron count the takings from the Jumble sale. Had supper out there. Got home about 11.30 pm. Quite early for me.
Entry.132: More driving today. Did fairly well. did some work on the bench too. Went out to Brixton for tea. Saw Bill. He is ever so much better. Looks well today. Bonny day again.
Entry.133:
Met Dad at 4.45 pm. Went round to Harry Brevitt then to the Trocadero for tea. From there to Molinari's for dinner. After dinner we went to see Marie Lohr in Victory. Enjoyed it immensely. but acting good. Came home after the show.

Janet, Marie & Co went to Eastbourne.
Entry.134: After the class rushed out to the hospital to Janet. Had tea & then the Matron took Sister Ellerben, Janet, Marie & me to the Bermondsey Town Hall to see her get presented avec a nice ivory set of brushes. Very nice they were too. We had a couple of dances but it was too hot. Came back to the hospital early & the Matron made coffee & scrambled eggs for us all. Gee it was goodo too.
Entry.135: Out to the hospital for tea. Janet & I had dinner in the doctors rooms at Matron's order. Some guys us. Left there at 11 pm & came home & wrote a couple of letters. Bill was walking today when I went out to the hospital. He's much better. Drew more money & bought a pair of boots. Janet & I were in charge of the hospital tonight.
Entry.136: Went out to Marie's flat for tea. Janet & Violet turned up at about 7 pm. Janet & I went to Hyde Park & listened to the band. Sat in chairs for half an hour but by some chance or other the man didn't ask me for any money for them. We left at 10 pm each catching the tube home.
Entry.137: Met Marie & Violet at 10 am & we went to see the Houses of Parliament. Took a snap of Police march. Had some ices. Met Janet at 1.15 pm & we went to Ye Olde Cheshire Cheese House for lunch. Went out to Hampstead Heath after lunch & then back to the flat for tea. Stayed there until 11.30 pm & then got the tube home. Took Violet & Janet to Hyde Park & listened to the band Once again we missed paying for our seats.
Entry.138: Went looking for a house after doing a bit of packing. No luck tho. Met the girls at 2.20 pm (20 minutes late they were). We intended going to hear Melba but couldn't get in so went & had a look at a church & then to the Museum. Gee its marvellous. Went back to the flat for tea & then to Regent's Park. Janet & I went out to the Hospital at 7.30 pm & the matron insisted on us having dinner with her. Was goodo too. She then made u s use her sitting room while she cleared out a cupboard. Some sport.
Entry.139: Went out to see Bill after getting smokes etc for him & he had gone out to see Marie. After driving lesson went out to Maries flat for tea. Janet came in later on. Played cards for a while.
Entry.140:
Left the class today after my driving lesson & went to Kings Cross & got a ticket for Janet. Had lunch with Harry & then went out to see Janet. She has to go to Brighton to see about a job tomorrow so isn't going to Scotland tonight. Violet took Janet's ticket & got into uniform & went. Had the wind up fearfully till the conductor punched the ticket & then she was pleased with herself. We all saw her off. Am going with Janet tomorrow.

Wednesday 21 May 1919

Met Janet at 10.15 am at Victoria & we went to Brighton. Cost us 8/6 each 1st class & she got a refund of
Entry.141: ½ for third class return ordinary. Arrived Brighton & found a place for lunch & then went down to the beach. All stones & not at all pretty. Not even as good as Adelaide beaches. Then on to a pier. Cost us 2d each. On the pier are theatres & orchestral places besides all sort of side shows. Then got a train & went out to the hospital. Janet went in while I walked about. She got her job & starts in a month. We then rushed back & had a fruit salad & ice each & got the train back to Victoria. Went out to Bermondsey to see Matron & had dinner with her then back to the flat for her parcels & then to the train. Got a good seat. Once again the guard stepped in & helped us. Real bonny day.
Entry.142: Hot again. Went to Brixton for tea. Missed lecture again. Had some ices with Bill at Arding & Hobbs.
Entry.143: As usual hot again. Went to the motor class & from there out to Marie's to tea. Bill was there but left at 6 pm. Marie & I took him to the bus & then went visiting but the people weren't home. Went back to the flat & played Rummy & Crib. Moved into new room at the flat. 40/- per week.
Entry.144: Went to Reading with Bill. Had lunch there. Went to the River. Met Ada Warwick & went on the river. She is now engaged to a Canadian. Got a touch of the sun & feel very seedy. Have a beautiful headache.
Entry.145: Our Epsom trip is off cos Marie's father has arrived. He's here for two or three days. Am pleased its off cos I feel very seedy. Wrote 8 letters mostly to Aussie. Went out to Maries for tea. Had something to eat here at the flat for lunch. Met Mr Fraser. We went to Westminister & then to Kings Cross. Then back to the flat for supper. Came home early. Rained part of the day.
Entry.146:
Didn't know what to do with myself in the evening so went to the new theatre Winter Garden & saw Kissing Time. Phyllis Dare & Co. Was very good. Started at 8 pm & finished at 11.10 pm. Was quite decent tho.

Very dull day.
Entry.147: Fine again this morning. Went to bank & drew out £5 & paid in 13/-. Actually did some work today at the school. My writing yesterday bore fruit. SWent out to Brixton for tea. Wrote a long letter to Janet.
Entry.148: Gave Bill 4 letters. Went to see Harry Brevitt & then came home. Had tea again from the old lady & then went to see the Russian Ballet. Hawker was there. Band played for he's a jolly good fellow. Hawker bowed & crowd demanded a speech. They got 'Thank you very much indeed'. Show was very good indeed. Enjoyed it.
Entry.149: Sorted out photos for my album. Had phone messages from Dad H. Met Bill at 4.15 & rushed to Paddington to see Dad but got there only just in time to have a look thro half the train. didn't see him. Had dinner & then went to see Eyes of Youth. Liked it very much. Brought Bill home & we both slept in my bed. Some crowd too.
Entry.150: Didn't sleep too well. Had a talk with McMillan about the house. Leave here next Friday. Got £3.17.0 refund. Gee he's scotch to the back bone. Bill had brekker at the flat & we had lunch at Arding & Hobbs at Clapham Junction. Came home early. Old lady gave me tea twice. did up my photos & went to bed.
Entry.151: No Southend today as Bill sick again. Went to Eaton Place. Met Delepwawde & Gawsey. Went to Harry Brevitts place & then to lunch at Molinari's & then to lunch at Molinari's then to Marie's but she wasn't home so came back to flat. Read & wrote letters. Scrubbed my cap & boots.
Entry.152: Shaved & washed some clothes. After lunch went out to the hospital to see Bill. He had been sent back to bed on a/c of having a temp. Still was far from well. Marie rang up & then came out. Had tea at the hospital. Took her home & then came home myself.
Entry.153: Went to see people at Grosvenor Place about Polytechnic. No good tho. Had driving lesson & lecture. Came home & wrote, read & washed a pair of slacks. Looks very much like rain.
Entry.154: Went to Garage & did a bit of work. Bill & I had dinner together & then went to Hyde Park for a walk. Came home early & read.
Entry.155:
Derby Day

Rain today. Went to the garage for an hour & then to Reading. Had a good time. Went to Sonning. Walked of course. The Derby provided a huge surprise for everybody. Grand Parade won when everyone thought The Panther would.
Entry.156: Garage all day. Bill came home with me & we went to Marie's for tea. Stayed there till 9. Came home & wrote & read. Also did a bit of packing.
Entry.157: Packed. Squared up. Took my trunk & valise to Pritchard Place. Went to Horseferry Rd for ½ fare vouchers. Got 3rd class voucher & ticket. The old lady gave me a sponge cake for the train. Went early to the train & got a corner seat. Had 2 naval boys & 3 ladies in the compartment. Wasn't comfy tho. Thought I'd be found out. Wasn't tho & arrived Glasgow OK.
Entry.158: Came out to Alice's place & had brekker. Ern. went in to meet me but we missed one another. Went to Queens Park in the afternoon & in the evening just went for a stroll. It rained in the afternoon after being a little bit dusty.
Entry.159: Went to the baths & had a swim. Gee it was good. Do me. After lunch we went round to Paisley & came home via Ruther Glen. Gee the place is beautifully green. Like it all much better. After we came home Ern. & I went into town to post a couple of letters. Of course it rained again.
Entry.160: Beautiful morning. Got 2 letters from Bill. He crashed for leave. Real stiff. Went into town twice. Second time to post some letter. Rained in the evening.
Entry.161: Took Arthur to the dentist & he had a tooth out Has to go again on Tuesday to get two filled. After lunch went to Queens Park & heard the Scotch Guard Band play. Was bonnie. They played the 'Missouri Waltz' & Chu Chin Chow. Went to the pictures in the evening. Rain again this evening.
Entry.162: Heavy thunder storm early this morning. Naturally there is plenty of rain. Had a hair cut today & go in tomorrow to get my hair treated. Ernest & I went to Renfrew by train. It is along the Clyde. Saw all the shipbuilding yards. Came home by crossing the river in a ferry & getting the train back. Everywhere one goes here there is one mass of children playing in the streets. The majority too are filthy dirty.
Entry.163: Wrote 8 pages home to all today. Very heavy thunder storm lightening & rain was very good. I enjoyed it. Met Moffitt in the afternoon & had tea with him. Went in to the hairdresser & got some advice about my hair. Harriet came out & she, Ernest & I went to the pictures & then took her home. Was quite decent coming back. Rain had stopped.
Entry.164: Nice & bright this morning. Quite a change from yesterday. Still taking medicine to clear my stomach. Went to Stephens Ship Building Yard at Linthouse in the afternoon with Ernest's brother in tow. Went all over the place & enjoyed it immensely. Saw a boat almost ready for launching. another just started. Keel only being laid. Another with just the ribs on & a torpedo boat launched & to be finished at the end of the month. Went over all the workings too. Took Alice & Ernest to a show in town. It was very poor tho. Real fine day all day.
Entry.165: Took the two kids into the station to meet Janet. She turned up at 11.30 am so went shopping & then out to Alices place for lunch. After lunch we went to a friend of Janets. Caught the 6.30 pm train to Gourock & then the boat to Stroue. The lochs here are very pretty. the whole place is much like Sydney if it only got plenty of sun. We arrived here at 9 pm. Had supper a walk & went to bed. Met all the family. They are very nice.
Entry.166: Rain all day. Janet & I went for a walk to Kilmaren in the morning & afternoon in the rain. Scotch people are quaint alright. Things are very quiet on Sundays. play cards & sing ragtime. Got engaged. Stroue is a very small place. Must be cold here in the winter. Even now its cold when its s'posed to be the middle of summer.
Entry.167: Mr Stewart & Willy left by 7.30 am boat & James got a letter telling him to go to Cardiff to see about a boat. He had to leave at 11 am to get the train in Glasgow. Rain all day. Went for a walk after tea. Too wet to do anything else.
Entry.168: Really fine in the morning. Janet & I went for a walk over the hills in the morning & in the afternoon Violet, Janet & I cycled to Loch Eck. Was lovely. It is a freshwater loch. Violet got a puncture & we didn't have any solution or rubber so stopped two men in a cycle side car & they gave us the necessary. Fixed it up & then came home. Went for a bonnie walk after tea.
Entry.169: Nice again today. There was a couple of showers tho. Wasn't too bad tho. Janet & I cycled to Loch Long & Ardentilly . Was bonny too. Hills & trees right on the road. After lunch we stayed home & talked to Janet's Sister in law. After tea she went home & Violet, Janet & I cycled to Glen Massan falls. Very nice there too. We were driven away from the place tho by Midges (gnats).
Entry.170: Intended going to Loch Lomond but it is far too wet. Forgot to close my window in the night & all my clothes got soaked. Rain cleared in the afternoon & Violet, Janet & I cycled to Dunoon. Had an ice & bought some cakes & then came home. Went to Blairmore & saw the village maid (she isn't all there).
Entry.171: Fine for a while so we started for Loch Lomond. Had to change boats at Kilcraggen & then to a train at Craigendoran We missed the train at 11 am & had to wait till 1.30 pm. So went into Helensburg & had lunch. got the train at Craigendoran at 1.30 & went to Arrochar & from there walked to Tarbett. The train trip was goodo. Beautiful scenery. Came right along two Lochs. Loch Loy & Gare Loch. Missed the boat at Tarbett so went for a walk along the banks of Loch Lomond. Very nice indeed. Got the train back & had to wait 1 ½ hours at Criagendoran again. got a boat home tho. Had a most enjoyable day. Do me everytime. It rained very heavily all the morning but was nice and warm after lunch.
Entry.172: Real bonny day today. Went for a ride on the bikes. Did some printing of photos. Went over to Greenock in the afternoon & met John. We ate all his strawberries too besides a big tea. He is very nice. Walked to Gourock & got the 8 pm boat there. Quite cold tonight. Mr Stewart & Willy home for the weekend. Looks like rain.
Entry.173:
Rain again. Wrote home & to Hadfields re Mr letter. Janet packed. Had the wind up ill this morning. Talked father after tea if I could have Janet. Caused some amusement to the family who were in the kitchen. Everybody was tickled to death. Rained all day. Only able to go for a walk for about an hour.

Fritz scuttled his 70 boats in Scapa Flow. Caused some sensation too.
Entry.174: Cold & windy today. We got the 9 am boat. Janet & Violet came down to see us off. Got the train to Glasgow. Arthur met us there & after taking our luggage to Queen St Station we went out to Alice's for lunch. Saw them all. Broke the news & they were all pleased. Came to Edinburgh & Janet went to visit pals whilst I went to Corstorphine. Told Auntie & she was pleased. Saw Adolph again. He annoys me. I put up with him tho. Met Janet at Frasers. We told them & poor Janet got a lecture. Had a huge rush for our train but got a whole compartment to ourselves whilst the rest of the train was packed. A guard even locked the door for us. Had a bonny sleep.
Entry.175:
Midsummer (British Isles)

Bonny journey. Slept about 5 hours. Brekker at Kings Cross Hotel. Went to Victoria & got a ticket for Brighton & then back to Kings X. Got a taxi & took trunk & selves to Victoria. Had bother over the ticket but got it set OK. Put Janet in the train & then got one myself for Clapham Junction. Came out to my digs. Wrote a couple of letters. Went down to the garage. Took a sergeant to Eaton Place. Had dinner & came home to bed. Some tired too.
Entry.176: Down at garage about 11. Had a bonny sleep. Wandered about till 8 pm & then went to Bills dugout. We went to dinner & then out Marie's flat for mail. None there tho. Came home about 11 pm. A letter from Janet awaiting me. Answered it & went to bed. Rained for ½ an hour or so in the afternoon.
Entry.177: Cold today. Had a drive & did OK. After lunch I went home & wrote a couple of letters. Went round to garage & worked. Came home & read & then went to Bill's place. We went out to dinner & then walked over to Battersea Park & to Victoria Palace. Couldn't get in so walked back to his flat. Came home at 10.30.
Entry.178: Garage at 10 am. Drive early. Did reverse & starting up a hill & did very well. Do me. Had lunch at Bill's place & then we went to Olympia. The Queen, Princess Mary & Prince Henry were there too. They got a huge ovation. The show was good. Consisted of physical jerks by Waacs & soldiers. Tanks in action. Infantry in action. Frog Cavalry. 18 pounders & two teams of gun running. Also some Scotties dancing. We enjoyed it immensely. Had dinner & then went to Hyde Park & listened to the band. Came home early & read.
Entry.179:
PEACE SIGNED

Up early & round to Bill to tell him I was going to Brighton. Got the 11 am Pullman & arrived in Brighton at 128 pm. Had lunch at St James Restaurant & then went out to the hospital & waited for Janet. She turned up at 2.30 & we then went for a stroll. Watched some cricket near the racecourse & then went into town for tea. Walked along the esplanade to Hove & then into town again for dinner. Quite a huge crowd in the streets. One could hardly move. Rockets, crackers, whistles trumpets. All sorts of things used for making a noise cos peace was signed at 3.30 pm. Got the 9.50 back to London. Searchlights were going everywhere here.
Entry.180: Had lunch at Bill's place & then we went to Twickenham & got Mr Davison's boat & went on the river. Before going on tho we had lunch at a funny old place. Quite a decent lunch tho. Stayed on the river till 5.30 after both of us getting blisters. Came back to town & had dinner. Got hit to buy too for it. We then went into Trafalgar Square, & to Buckingham Palace & to Piccadilly. Gee the crowds were enormous. One could hardly move. The star on Nelson Monument is up on 50 meaning 50 millions collected. Quite cold tho. Went to bed at 10.45 pm.
Entry.181: Cold today. Have a lovely sore lip. Did very little all day. Bill & I went to pictures in the evening. They were very good. One dealt with the drunk question & another with divorce. Both well staged & acted.
Entry.182: Had drive & then went down to Brighton. Left from London Bridge. Had lunch at Brighton. It rained a bit. Janet & I went for a walk & then had tea in Kemp Town & afterwards she had to go back for duty. Got the 6.42 to London Bridge. Had something to eat & then came home to bed. Cos it was cold.
Entry.183: Rained some this morning. Had my lesson, lunch at Arding & Hobbs. Went in to town in met Bill & then we met Trix & she took me into the city & we did some shopping. Tried to get a coat for Mother but couldn't find one till we got to Oxford St. Bought scarves for the girls, Mother & Janet. Went round to Harry Brevitt & had tea. Didn't leave him till 8.30. Bill & he were almost blethered. Both very merry. Then we met George & had dinner. Went to Bills place & read & then came home to bed.
Entry.184: Rained in the morning. Went to Earls Court & got my cake then to Maries flat. She wasn't in but waited till she came. Got told off for not writing & telling her about the engagement. Through speaking so long to her I missed a train to Brighton. Got one half an hour later. Janet met me at the train. We walked a bit & then went on to the Palace then till it was time for my train. My lip is improving. Gee it is some sore tho.
Entry.185:
Fine today. The car broke down whilst I was having my lesson so went into town. Booked seats & a table for dinner for tomorrow night. Met Bill & George at the bank & had lunch with them. Took a couple of photos. One of Aussie House & a couple of Trafalgar Square. Planes were flying about dropping leaflets advertising the London .

Met Bill again & had dinner at his place & then we went out to Marie's. Left early tho & took George to the train & then came home.
Entry.186: Here we are once again. Am 25 today. Some huge age too. Met Janet at Victoria at 2.30. Poor kid she had had some rushing at Brighton. We got a bus to Ludgate Circus & then walked to Liverpool St. Went into 3 jewellers before buying the ring. Cost £16/10/ & is very decent. Not quite as good as some I would like to have bought. Still finance was the trouble. Went back to Hyde Park for a stroll then to the Trocadero for dinner & then to see Monsieur Beaucaire at the Princes. Gee it was lovely. Thoroughly enjoyed it. Got the 12.5 to Brighton. Had to get a policeman to help me wake up the hotel people. Then took Janet home & came back to bed. Was in by 3 am. A most glorious day. Did me.
Entry.187: Up at 7.30. Brekker in bed. Bonny bath too. Read the papers & then went for a stroll on to the esplanade & West pier. A lot of swimming going on but very poor. Met Whitehead. He said I might get a boat without going into camp by going to Belgrave Sq & will go tomorrow. Met Janet at 6 pm. We went for a stroll. Then had something to eat & then to the beach. Got the 9.35 pm train back. Slept nearly all the way too. Train stopped at the Junction so got out & was in bed at 11 pm. Goodo. Marie sent me a book of poems by Mrs Wilcox as a birthday present.
Entry.188: Very dull all day. Went to Belgrave Sq. but they can't help me cos I'm on N.M.E. Went & saw Carroll. Finish up on Wednesday. Met Ernie at 4 pm & we went to Harrods & bought a cake for Claire. Bonny too. Took her to tea there & then had a hair cut & went out to Maries. Left there early & went home & packed.
Entry.189: Finished packing & then to the bank. Got the 11 am train to Brighton. Janet got the whole afternoon off so we were OK. We went out Dyke Road way. Went back to town for dinner then on to the beach finishing up getting the 9.50 back to town. Not if isn't the last time I'll see her here.
Entry.190:
Very laid back today. Went to Belgrave Eaton Place but they can't help me 
 Some rush today. A real bonny warm day. Went to Eaton Place. Got a paper there & went to St Georges Sq. from there to Horseferry Rd clothing depot then to Regency St. then back to the Road then to Gt Peter St. for my pay book. They couldn't fix me up till 2 pm so went away & had lunch with Bill. Took my trunk & valise to Paddington. Went back & got my pay book then we went to the Army & Navy Stores & got a pocket book. Janet gave it to me for my birthday. We had ices, strawberries & cream & a drink there too. Bill then went out to tea while I had a rush to get my train. Got a taxi OK for the camp. Reported at No 2 Group. Allotted to No 4 Mess. Had a feed & got a bed. Met one or two I knew.
Entry.191: Warm again today. Went to the doc, & got my papers made out. Nothing else to do all day. Went to the Y.M. & had both morning & afternoon tea. Some excitement I don't think.
Entry.192: Nice & warm again today. Had a bonny cold shower. Do me. Nosed around & got on a quota (59). They leave somewhere about the 20th. Do me. Wrote a few letters at the Y.M. Usual morning & afternoon tea.
Entry.193: Rain all the morning but fine again in the afternoon. Was orderly officer all day but only just saw the camp in the distance usual tea. Played patience nearly all day.
Entry.194:
Dad's Birthday

Many Happy Returns old man. Bonny day all day. Wrote a couple of letters. Met Garnsey. only came down last night. Had tea with him. Am set for the 59 quota. Should leave on the Ulysses next week sometime. Went into Warminster for a rise.
Entry.195: Bit cloudy & dull today. Wrote a few letters. Had tea at the Y.M.
Entry.196: Got taken off the quota 'cos the strength was reduced. Was playing bridge in the evening when the adjt. came along & said he thought I'd checked for it again but to go to the office in the morning & make sure. Won 4/- at bridge. A huge amount for me.
Entry.197: Rushed around to make sure I was on the quota but found that I had missed. Saw orderly & rushed my leave thro' & got the 11.30 am to Newport & from there to Brecon. Arrived at Brecon at 5.30. Went to Gamitige Place & had dinner. We talked till 11 & then went to bed. I was tired too.
Entry.198: Auntie & I talked nearly all day. After tea we went to see Aunt Hannah. She saw us in her bedroom. She looks very old indeed. Says she wouldn't know me cos I was better looking than she thought. Uncle Bill wishes to be remembered to every body home.
Entry.199:
Auntie gave me a Sov. for a watch chain. Used 10/- towards my fare. Trains were all late. Had dinner on the train. Got into London at 9.15 & then came down to Jermyn Court Hotel & got a bonny room. Went for a walk down Haymarket thro Admiralty Arch to Buckingham Square then to Westminster & along Whitehall & Haymarket & back to the Hotel. A tremendous crowd already. Cars galore could hardly move the whole place is marvellously decorated. Looks bonny. Got a letter from Janet at the hotel.

Peace Day March
Entry.200: Went to London Bridge to meet the train from Brighton at 8.19 but that train wasn't running so went to Victoria & met the 9.15. Poor Janet had to wait an hour at the Brighton end. We went into the Street & got a fair position for the procession. Gee it was some crowd & they went absolutely mad when Foch, Beatty and Haig went by. We saw the whole lot & had a very decent view. Saw all the big heads. After the procession we walked to Sloan Sq. & had something to eat. A huge queue waited for tickets for the railway at the station. We wandered around & finally got the 3.40 pm to Brighton. Got my room OK & then had tea & a walk. Brighton was mad too. They had a procession etc. dancing on the esplanade & a bonny display of fireworks. They were the best I've ever seen. Gee it was magnificent. It rained just before the display too. It finished at 11.15 pm. Took Janet home after being in a rush for a train & then came back to bed. Gee I'm some tired.
Entry.201: Bed goodo. Had brekker there. Went outside at 11.45 am & and then got a bus to Rottingdean. Not much of a place. It had rained some during the night. Quite fresh outside. Met Janet a 4.15 & we went & had tea & then got a train to Dyke Road & from there got a bus to the Dyke. Came straight back & went for a walk. Took Janet home at 10.30 pm & then went back to the hotel. Parlied avec a french madamoiselle who couldn't speak english & then went up to bed.
Entry.202: Up at 8 am. Had bath & brekker & then rushed around to Boots to see about some spools. They refunded me the money on some Janet had bought. Got the 10 am train to Victoria. It was late arriving & as I had to do some shopping it meant some bustle & hurry. Had only 3 mins to get my ticket & get a seat. Arrived at Sutton Veny about 3.30 pm. Had a look for orders. Have missed the Demosthenes but my name has been sent on for the Argyllshire. Hope I get it. It leaves on Sunday. Went to bed fairly early.
Entry.203: Rained all day. Got an issue of some underclothing. Got a note to report to 61 quota. Will do so tomorrow. Had tea as usual.
Entry.204: Went down & reported & asked for leave for tomorrow. Got it OK. Garnsey & I went to Bath. Had a look at the Roman Baths, a walk thro. the town & then went & watched the County cricket match between Somerset & Derbyshire. Was very tame indeed.
Entry.205: Got the 10.20 to town & met Janet at Victoria at 1.40. We then had lunch & went by train to Clapham Common & by bus from there to Leatherhead. We had tea there & walked about a lot & then got a train to London Bridge. Janet got her train from there at 9.10 to Brighton. I then went & saw Marie & had supper at the flat. Left there at 11.30 & got the midnight train.
Entry.206:
Claires' Birthday

Many happy returns Kiddie. Had to wait at Swindon 3 hrs but got into the train & slept. Arrived at Warminister at 7.30. Got a car to camp. At morning tea I met quite a crowd I knew. Was given a platoon this morning. 

Drew £12 for voyage
Entry.207: Parade as usual this morning. Nothing else of note happened all day 'cept in the evening some of the crowd got drunk & kicked up a noise. Sent a cable home. Played bridge & won 1/6.
Entry.208: Didn't go to church parade. Played cards & won 7/6. Had a bath, developed a spool & went for a walk to one of the old Roman Camps. Gee they are marvellous old things. They are really strongholds & redoubts & must have taken a terrible amount of taking. Even now they would be hard. Took a snap of it but don't think it will show up too well.
Entry.209: Two parades today. Asked for leave for tomorrow & got it alright. Bill came down tonight. Played bridge again & won. Do me when I win.
Entry.210: Got the 8.19 to town & the 1.55 to Brighton. Janet met me at the station. We went to the hotel & got a room & then had tea. Went for a stroll along the cliffs came back & had dinner & then all over the race course for a walk. Won't see the dear kid again until she comes home to me.
Entry.211: Up at 20 to 8. Gee I had to go some to get my train to Vic. Went round to Belgrave Sq & put in an app for Janet to come out at the end of April. Saw Trix & had a yarn with her. Got the 12.15 to Warminster & arrived here at 3 pm. Had tea with Bill. The Y.M.C.A. put up a good concert & then an open air dance tonight. Wrote 10 letters & went to be at 11 pm.
Entry.212: Had a couple of parades & got things straightened. Got our trunks & valises over. Had another parade at 8.45 pm & after a roll call they moved into the station. I went in by car with 5 or 6 officers kits after wiring my name. The Major came in after me to the station & said I had also to report to another Major. Missed the first train over it anyway. Still the second train will do me. We fall in at 11 pm.
Entry.213: Left at 1.40 am from Warminster & arrived at Liverpool at 10.30 am. Stopped at Birmingham & managed to get a cup of tea & some sandwiches. They were goodo too. Slept nearly all the way & am still tired. The train stopped near the boat so didn't have far to go to the boat. Went straight onboard. Have a cabin with Ross Knickey and the Q.M. (Lt Howell's). Had a good lunch. Got our gear into our cabin & then had dinner. Met Gus Edwards & Peter Ross. Got Gus to send a couple of wires for me. Had a letter from Janet & wrote her one. Am officer of the guard tomorrow. We don't pull out till tomorrow sometime.
Entry.214: Boat pulled away at 11.30 am & pulled up waiting for the tide at 1.30 pm. Had another bonny letter from Janet. Sent her just a note just before I got hers. Went on duty at 9 am. Gee it was funny. Nobody knew where the posts were. Had to get a ships officer to show me them all. The meals on board are very good.
Entry.215:
Slept very well last night. Finished guard at 9 am. Do me too. Bonny weather still. Took some Gregory's. Slept nearly all day. Had a boat drill parade today.

Am in charge of a boat with 33 men.
Entry.216: Very warm today. Did nothing but read. Played a few games & also cards. Ship ran 330 miles yesterday. Saw 3 whales & 3 boats. Some excitement. Played bridge before lunch & in one rubber was down 701. Finished the game after dinner & won by 1000 (5/-) for us. Do me.
Entry.217: Mild today. Played deck quoits all day. A dancing class started this afternoon for officers but is very poor so am not joining in. The Colonel spoke to the men about leave at ports & giving the 'birds' a fair go on board. Played bridge & lost 4/- so I'm just about even.
Entry.218: Up at 7 am & did some P.T. Not bad either about 5 of us got going. Played quoits & won. Saw 3 boats. Printed a couple of photos of Janet. They are good too. I'm pleased cos I wanted them to be good. Watched the Diggers box then they had a sing song. The diggers have started a dancing class.
Entry.219: Calm again all day. Played quoits. Did P.T. & played cards. Passed Canary Islands at tea time. Quite a lot of boats in the harbour & two quite decent Towers. More boxing after dinner & a cinema show. It was goodo too. Gee the remarks of the diggers was funny.
Entry.220:
Chry's & Madge's birthday

Been thinking a lot about the girls today. Hope they had a pleasant time. Very dull today. Felt like sleeping all day. Played quoits & cards. The diggers had a concert in the evening. It was very poor tho'.
Entry.221: Very warm indeed today. Coy. Orderly Officer today. Had to fill in a lot of forms about deferred pay. Got inoculated against flue. Saw quite a lot of dolphins & showers today. Also on ship. Another cinema show tonight it was quite good. Am one of three officers on guard tomorrow.
Entry.222: A big storm early this morning. A lot of hammocks. blankets & clothing got washed overboard. Had a muster parade in case we had lost a digger but everything was correct. Am on guard again. My hours are 9 to 1 twice. Not at all bad. Bonny breeze all day. Played my tournament game of quoits with my partner. We won fairly easily. I played poorly tho.
Entry.223: Nothing to do all day. Fairly windy all day. Played patience & 3 handed bridge. Supposed to be opposite Sierra Leone this afternoon. Am going to bed early 10 pm.
Entry.224: Very windy all day. A little rain. Not much tho. Got an officers team of 8 for a tug of war & we pulled 9 others. Was good. Had a bonny concert tonight. Was very good indeed. The concert party gave it. Should pass the equator tomorrow sometime.
Entry.225: Crossed the line this morning. Colonel caught us playing poker & asked us not to play. We then played sevens & he thinking we were still at poker came over & said 'Gentlemen, I asked you not to play. Am I to call the adjutant' When he saw it was sevens he bolted. Bonny day. My arms & face got horribly sunburnt. Was judge today for 4 fights. They were all good & required just a little bit of thinking out. Didn't give a bad decision at all. Am pleased. Saw the Southern Cross for the first time.
Entry.226: Nice breeze today. Read most of the day, but gee I'm some unsettled. Can't be bothered reading for long. Must go for a walk somewhere. Was in for two sweeps today & won both. Brought in £3.16.0. Not at all bad. Do me. Had a fancy dress ball tonight. Gee its some fun. Some of the costumes were good.
Entry.227: Quite cold today. The fancy dress people had their photos taken. Some of the costumes were rough. Particularly the colonels & one or two diggers. Had pillow fighting today. Some of the fancy costumes had a try too. An officer had a good civvy suit pinched last night. This is the third lot. It appears a digger went into the cabin locked the door & passed out the suit thro the port & then got thro himself. All officers were inoculated against flu this afternoon
Entry.228: Cold & windy today. The boat is rolling a bit. Had a meeting of officers about the thieving this morning. Going to have a Kit inspection. just before lunch the Kit inspection was cancelled. Judged three fights today & the fighting was very good indeed. The officers team pulled F Coy diggers team in tug of war & won 2 out of 3. The end of the boat won each time. Some 40 odd diggers had a bolshivick meeting & demanded more deck space. Silly old colonel gave it to them too. Think he's frightened of them. Gee its icy cold tonight. The boat is rolling & pitching to some order too.
Entry.229: Very cold again today. Still a big sea. Quite a lot of the diggers are down with sea sickness. Did absolutely nothing all day. Saw another whale. Came third in the big sweep & got 10/- but was halves with another officer. Still 5/- is handy any old time. The C. O. received a petition today from 240 diggers asking for the release of the prisoners. It was refused.
Entry.230: On guard once more. Have only the birds to concern ourselves with all day but in the evening we still have to look after the whole ship. Some more boxing today. Two very good fights. The third was poor. Should be some good ones tomorrow. Quite a lot of rumors flying around as to where we are going. Cape Town or Durban. The first I think. Still a heavy swell on & the boat is moving some. My hours of duty are 11 am to 1 pm. 5 pm to 7 pm. 1 am to 4 am.
Entry.231: 2 am Some cold. Still big sea. Old ship creaking some. Went to bed at 4 & up again at 8.30. Nearly crashed for brekker. After brekker had my shave & then went out & refereed a fight. Did another one after lunch. They were both good fights. Plenty of ginger in them. Saw a big shark quite close to the boat. Had a boat drill today. Everybody rushed to their boat stations. Played rummy sevens & rickety Kate after dinner. Had some fun too. Have only 600 odd miles to Cape Town from mid day today
Entry.232:
Cold again. Sea calmed just a little. Passed a boat quite close. Was the Marathon or Miltiades. Duties for Cape Town are out & so far I've slipped for duty. Do me. Played rummy for about 3 hours after dinner.

The nigger who challenged any body on the boat has been matched for £s aside. Have £1 on the unknown with Dal.

Some slight trouble with the guard last night. Lent my colt to Cooper in case of trouble with the guard.
Entry.233: Sea absolutely calm all day. Thick mist about too. Passed a couple of boats. Played cards & read all day. Dropped anchor just outside Cape Town about 8 pm. A boat came alongside evidently with doctors & staff. Finished my long series of letters to Nettie. Was 24 pages.
Entry.234: Went in alongside No 2 wharf at brekker time. Kept waiting till about 11 am before we were allowed ashore. Got a car from the wharf to the P.O. & posted our letters. Bought some post cards & some camera stuff & then had tea. Wrote the post cards there. Went into a jewellers & had a look around & then round to the Grand Hotel for lunch. Couldn't get any there till late so wandered out & went to some cafe. Very poor. After lunch spoke to a person & he told us to get a car & go to Hout Bay for a spin. We did & it was goodo. Very pretty all the way. Table Mtn. was enveloped in clouds all day. Visited Rhodes house & gee it is bonny. His taste was good. Had dinner at the Mount Nelson hotel & came back about 9.45 pm. The Main was berthed next to us.
Entry.235: The Main is a family boat & gee it is some rough. Do hope dear old Nettie doesn't strike one of these things. Quite a lot of birds came onboard today drunk to the world. We left at 11 am & pulled out & awaited our 8 prisoners. They came on about 11.30 & then we steamed out. Our mails left today by the Edinburgh Castle. Took a few snaps. The old boat is rolling some. There is a big land swell. Ate oranges from the Comforts Fund & read some aussie papers after dinner. Had the tables all boarded up at dinner tonight to keep the plates quiet. Saw Sister Gallin & Lt. Anderson on board the Main. Our guards gave a bit of trouble. We are 10 men short.
Entry.236:
Stomach upset. Will have to take some Gregory's. It doesn't take much to put a color on my tongue these days. Think I want a lot of football. Read today & did a bit of printing. All my photos of Cape Town turned out well.

Feel upside down tonight. Just can't be bothered doing anything.
Entry.237: See the coast all day. Saw a few farms. Very little of the ground tho was cultivated. The majority of it looked very bare with trees & shrubs here & there & plenty of rocks. Nice big breeze. Read all day. Played a few hands of rummy & sevens after dinner.
Entry.238: Reached Durban about 8 am & went in to the stream about 9 am. Tied up alongside another till 3 when we went in to a wharf taking the place of a departing passenger boat for Blighty. Niggers everywhere. The boys threw down pennies then the niggers fought for them. On guard again. Did my first relief at 5 pm. Everything quiet till 6.30 pm when the Adjutant came along & we found two prisoners missing. Some row then. Sent out search parties but they were missing alright. Never found them up to 10 pm.
Entry.239: 5am. On duty again. No sign of missing prisoners. All sorts of theories. Court of Enquiry at 9 am today about it all. Have warned our sentries to be there for it Came off at 9 am. Had brekker & then into the Court of Enquiry. Gave my evidence. Told everything I knew. It was adjourned till Friday. Went up to a few shops in a rickshaw with Fraser. Came back to lunch. After lunch Shelley & I went up to town. It is a big place but don't like it as much as Adelaide. Did some shopping & then went & saw the All Blacks beat Natal 17 points to 3. Was a good game. Ground was fair. Had turf on it but was of poor quality. Came back to the boat for dinner. More than half the officers did the same. After dinner Forrest, Dalrymple & I went to see a show at the Criterion. It was half picture & half Vaudeville. It was very poor indeed. Had coffee at the Royal hotel & then got a tram & came back to the ship to sleep. The Borda from Aussie came in a midday & is berthed alongside us.
Entry.240: Nice & bright today. Old Botha is dead. Crossed over to the bluff in a ferry & walked a few miles along the beach to a big whaling Coy's cutting up & melting down station. No whales in. Had a look at the place. Nothing in a whale is lost at all. Oil, bones or flesh. Flesh & bones made into manure. Went back to the boat over the hill. Took the sweat out of us too. After lunch went into town & down to the beach. Had one or two ices. Did some shopping & then came back to the boat. It had moved over to the coaling station. Have to go & come by ferry now. Expect to go to Pietermaritzburg tomorrow. Have two parties.
Entry.241: No Maritzburg for me today 'cos the Court of Enquiry is on. We didn't finish this morning but have one more witness to examine. After the court Osborne & I were put on guard so that we could go to Martizburg tomorrow. Finished my letter to Nettie. Went on Guard at 5 pm & came off at 1 am. starting during this guard. Rained fairly steadily during the night. Had a big thunder storm at 1 am.
Entry.242: The court sat again today. It has finished now tho' I think. Went ashore at 11 am. Got a car (Cadillac) & went to Amanzimtoti River. It is about 20 miles away from here. Had a most interesting day. Had a race with a train & won. Had lunch at an hotel out there & then rowed to the end of the river. Got out there & walked up a steep hill & visited a few Kraals. Very good. Took some snaps. Every snap we took of a nigger we had to give 6d. Dead funny. Kraals were very clean. Cow & pigs etc. don't sleep with the family but outside in an enclosure. Had dinner at the Marine Hotel (the best in the place) & then came back to the boat. Had a most interesting day. It rained again just after we came back.
Entry.243: Left Durban about 9 am. Only lost 17 more men making a total of 26 since we left London. We sent two captains over to the Bahia Costilles & the Bakara is sending 150 men & some officers. Guess that will wake the mutineers up some. Very heavy swell all day. Quite a lot sick & a lot missed dinner. I slept nearly all day. Am not too bad. Things have been falling over all day long. Very little breeze. Sky is quite clear today & tonight it is glorious. Saw hundreds of divers diving into the water after fish Looked well. Posted a letter to Nettie.
Entry.244: Some day today. Very rough all day. In the evening a gale came to light. Made myself sick in the morning & have been sick 3 times since. No good to me. Have read all day. Intend going to be early. Passed a schooner at lunch time.
Entry.245: Big sea again all day. Very little sleep last night on account of ship rolling. Quite a lot skipped for meals again today. Came third in the sweep & collected 8/-. Makes £4/8/- now I've collected. Am not quite OK again yet but am nearly so. Didn't miss any meals & wasn't sick, but am still a little bit squamish. Am ships orderly officer tomorrow.
Entry.246: Orderly officer today. Didn't get up till 7.30 tho' instead of 6 am. Did very little very squaly all day. Very heavy thunderstorm & big hail in the afternoon. Very cold. The Adjutant told me confidentially that the enquiry was OK. for me. No word about it for anybody else tho. Pay day today. Collected £30. Have managed to save £23 out of Netties passage money. Do me.
Entry.247: Very cold again today. Rain off & on all day. Very windy too. Lot of hail. Fire in Saloon. Had a concert at 8 pm in our saloon. Sang 'bring me a restful soul & you gave me comfort'. Got the strength of the enquiry. The corporal & the officer of the guard are to blame. Nothing about me at all. Do me.
Entry.248: Had a bad night. Very few people had a good one here. Boat rolled & tossed about all night. Very big seas. Two big wash places for the men were absolutely wrecked & washed overboard. One officers cabin got washed out & two or three decks (mens) had 2 & 3 feet of water in them. The men had a bad time. Still a bog sea on today. Very cold all day. Had plenty of rain & hail. Won 10/- in a sweep. Slept nearly all the afternoon.
Entry.249: Saw the sun for a while today. Not so cold & windy. Had a bad cut today & got my tooth fixed up once more. Read all day again. My eyes are aching a bit.
Entry.250: Much milder again. Read a lot & played two or three games. Colonel told O.C. companies today that there must not be any noise on deck till after 5 pm. that the 'subs must keep away from the fire & that cigarettes & matches must not thrown on the floor.
Entry.251: Not so windy today. When playing with a life belt we threw it overboard. It is only about our fifth. Hurt my finger.
Entry.252:
Did a bit of sewing. Got one of the sisters to sew my colors on for me also my huge decorations. Lost another life belt. Filled in forms regarding duteable goods. Was coy. orderly officer. Sang in a concert in the saloon. Sang Heart of a Rose For You Alone & Theres a little bit of 
good
 bad in every good little girl. We were half way home at 5 am. Still very decent weather. Actually saw the sun for about an hour.
Entry.253: Cold again today. Nothing much doing 'cept a little excitement now we are getting near home.. Hurt my left arm playing with the medicine ball. Not much tho. Am on guard tomorrow.
Entry.254: Went on guard at 9 am & came off at 1.30 pm & on again at 9.so pm & off again at 1 am. Cold all day. Nothing strange happened with the guard. In the afternoon had 5 fights & acted as judge. Very fair some of them were too.
Entry.255: Very sleepy today. Still icy cold. Old boat starting to roll again. No fights at all today from pulling out an account of a decision by the referee yesterday. He disqualified a man for ear biting & some of them seem to think he was wrong. He wasn't tho. Quite a lot of wireless messages for the boys from their people. Am not going to send any home. Did some more patching & rethreaded the beads for one of the kids.
Entry.256: Did nothing but read & play all day. After dinner a crowd of us went into the dining saloon & sang ourselves hoarse.
Entry.257: Coy. orderly officer today. Helped the Q.M. all the morning with Q1 forms. Played the rest of the day & managed to hurt both arms again. Think I must have strained the sinews in each. They ache some. Only have 991 miles to do for Adelaide now. Do me.
Entry.258: The boys changed round this afternoon into different corps according to their states. No trouble at all. Gave the QM a hand in the morning.
Entry.259: Boat drill at 9.30. Had an inspection of kits at 2 pm for duteable goods. Had some good boxing in the afternoon & in the evening a fancy dress. Some of the costumes were miles ahead of the last issue. Snow Sharland had a nasty fit this morning & is now in hospital.
Entry.260:
Up late again. Gee I'm a beauty the last few days. Sharland is nearly better. Played avec the medicine ball in the afternoon. Kangaroo Island in sight at 4 pm. Gee it looks very interesting too. Took some snaps of albatrosses, Hope they turn out OK. After dinner we had a sing song & went mad. At dinner the colonel & the captain of the boat threw a couple of speeches at us. 

Reveille at 4 am in the morning for the troops. Brekker at 6 am for them & then at 7 am for us. Packed this afternoon too.
Entry.261: Reveille at 4 am for the troops. Got up at 6 am & had brekker at 7 am. Doctor & customs people came on board at 8 am & the doc had a look at all the troops. Started going ashore at 9.30 am. Dad, mother & Claire met me at the boat. Got my goods thro customs & handed them over to Graves Hill & Co to take to the station for me tomorrow. We came out to Eva's for lunch. Ell & Syd met us. May & Granny were with Eva to meet us home Dick came home after. Dad & I went into town & out to Keswick after lunch & I reported Was bonded & got leave till end Nov. Changed my money at Comm. Bank. Met a few I know. Tommy Said in particular. He wants me to play football with Norwood next year. Have to see the sec. next week. Do me. Mrs Edwards, Mrs Matthews & her daughter came to see us all in the evening. Dad & I talked till 11 pm
Entry.262: Claire & Syd came in to me at 7 am & talked.
